sentences.en: Fishermen fear valuable oyster and mussel beds could be decimated.
sentences.cn: 渔民们害怕宝贵的牡蛎和贻贝层会被破坏。

sentences.en: He had two dozen oysters and enjoyed every one of them.
sentences.cn: 他吃了两打牡蛎，每一个都吃得津津有味。
他叉了一只洛克菲勒牡蛎.

sentences.en: How can I pull the pearl from the burning oyster?
sentences.cn: 我怎样做才能算是从燃烧的牡蛎中取出珍珠？

sentences.en: I can offer you some oyster soup, compliments of the chef.
sentences.cn: 我可以向您免费提供一些牡蛎汤, 算厨师的一点敬意.

sentences.en: I enjoy eating oyster;  it's really delicious.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢吃牡蛎，它味道真美。

sentences.en: I enjoy eating oyster; it's really delicious.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢吃牡蛎, 它味道真美.

sentences.en: I find I fairly like eating when he finally persuades me to taste the oyster.
sentences.cn: 当他最后说服我尝尝牡蛎时,我发现我相当喜欢吃.

sentences.en: It's the pearl in the oyster, anyway.
sentences.cn: 这是蚌里的明珠, 不管怎么说.

sentences.en: Jean and his workers place a small piece of shell in the oyster.
sentences.cn: 吉恩和他的工人们在牡蛎中放一小片贝壳.

sentences.en: Oyster beds, on the mudflats, are a form of fish farming.
sentences.cn: 滩涂牡蛎养殖场是一种水产养殖方式。

sentences.en: Oyster biostromes are forming in the bays of the modern Mississippi delta.
sentences.cn: 在现代密西西比三角洲的海湾中正形成着牡蛎生物丘.

sentences.en: She left school feeling that the world was her oyster.
sentences.cn: 她中学毕业了,感到前途无限美好.

sentences.en: The islands consist of oyster reefs covered with a thin veneer of black mud.
sentences.cn: 由牡蛎礁构成的小岛上覆盖着一层薄薄的黑色软泥.
人生最得意[最有前途]的时刻.

sentences.en: What a delicious thing is an oyster!
You're young, you've got a lot of opportunity. The world is your oyster.
sentences.cn: 你还年轻，机会有的是。世界是属于你的。

words.tran_cn: 牡蛎，[无脊椎]蚝；沉默寡言的人

phrases.tran_cn: 平菇；蚝蘑；侧耳（等于oyster cap）

trans.tran_cn: 牡蛎，<俚>守秘密的人，鸡背肉，沉默寡言的人
trans.tran_en: a type of shellfish that can be eaten cooked or uncooked, and that produces a jewel called a pearl
